content.full_text: If a patient is admitted with glaucoma and the stage progresses during the admission, assign the code for highest stage documented. (Evidence: pg no: 49, L29-L30)
content.summary: When glaucoma stage progresses during hospital stay, code the highest stage reached during admission (Evidence: pg no: 49, L29-L30)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign code for highest stage documented when glaucoma progresses during admission (Evidence: pg no: 49, L30)
detailed_rules.explanation: When a patient's glaucoma worsens or progresses to a higher stage during the hospital stay, the final code should reflect the most severe stage reached (Evidence: pg no: 49, L29-L30)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Document initial glaucoma stage at admission

Step 3: Identify highest stage reached during admission
Step 4: Assign code corresponding to highest documented stage
Step 5: Ensure documentation supports stage progression
